title: Mount Glorious
text:
Mount Glorious is a rural <a href="Suburbs%20and%20localities%20%28Australia%29">locality</a> in the <a href="Moreton%20Bay%20Region">Moreton Bay Region</a>, <a href="Queensland">Queensland</a>, Australia. In the , Mount Glorious had a population of 296 people.
Geography.
Mount Glorious is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> which is part of the <a href="D%27Aguilar%20Range">D'Aguilar Range</a> and is a suburb in <a href="Moreton%20Bay%20Region">Moreton Bay Region</a> roughly north west of <a href="Brisbane">Brisbane</a>. The forest that surrounds the mountain village is part of <a href="Brisbane%20Forest%20Park">Brisbane Forest Park</a> and the <a href="D%27Aguilar%20National%20Park">D'Aguilar National Park</a>. Other mountains in the D'Aguilar Range include <a href="Mount%20Nebo%20%28Queensland%29">Mount Nebo</a>, <a href="Mount%20Pleasant%2C%20Queensland%20%28Moreton%20Bay%20Region%29">Mount Pleasant</a> and <a href="Mount%20Mee%2C%20Queensland">Mount Mee</a>. The peak is approximately above sea level.
History.
The locality name takes its name from the mountain, which was named as the result of a random remark by Elizabeth Patrick at a 1915 picnic, when she commented on the view.
Five blocks on the mountain were made available early in the 20th century, with the first block being bought by James O'Hara in 1903. In 1921, a real estate map advertised 31 blocks as 'Crest Estate : the first section', being subdivisions of Portion 9, Parish of Parker.
The mountain was the centre of a 4.4 magnitude <a href="earthquake">earthquake</a> in November 1960.
Amenities.
The <a href="Moreton%20Bay%20Regional%20Council">Moreton Bay Regional Council</a> operates a <a href="mobile%20library">mobile library</a> service which visits the Mount Glorious Hall on Mount Glorious Road.
Demographics.
In the , Mount Glorious recorded a population of 296 people, 48.6% female and 51.4% male. The median age of the Mount Glorious population was 49 years, 11 years above the national median of 38. 69.4% of people living in Mount Glorious were born in Australia. The other top responses for country of birth were England 9.3%, New Zealand 4.5%, Netherlands 1.0%, Italy 1.0% and India 1.0%. 88.0% of people spoke only English at home; the next most common languages were Dutch 1.0%, and Sinhalese 1.0%
